intro: Menodora scoparia, commonly known as the wild morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Menodora scoparia is known for its rapid growth and can become invasive in certain environments.
